text: Tan Aik Mong (6 April 1950 – 31 May 2020) was a Malaysian Chinese badminton player. He was the younger brother of Tan Aik Huang. ==Achievements== === Asian Championships === Men's singles {| class="sortable wikitable" style="font-size: 90%;" !Year !Venue !Opponent !Score !Result |- style="background:#ECF2FF" | align="center" |1971 |Jakarta, Indonesia | Junji Honma |15–5, 15–10 | style="text-align:left; background:white" |Gold Gold |} === Southeast Asian Peninsular Games === Men's singles {| class="sortable wikitable" style="font-size: 90%;" !Year !Venue !Opponent !Score !Result |- |- style="background:#FFAAAA" | align="center" |1973 | align="left" |Singapore, Singapore | align="left" | Punch Gunalan | align="left" | | style="text- align:left; background:white" |Silver Silver |} === International tournaments === Men's singles {| class="sortable wikitable" style="font-size: 90%;" !
